description: Erection of outbuilding in the rear garden
decision_conditions: The total height and eaves height of the proposed structure, comprising the existing and proposed outbuildings joined together, would exceed 2.5m, in conflict with Paragraphs E.1(e) (ii) and (f) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The application site is located on the pavement on Kingston Road New Malden immediate west of the Fountain Roundabout adjacent the bus shelter and in close proximity to a number of residential properties.The surrounding area is mixed in use. The site is not in a conservation area and the buildings and curtilage are not statutorily or locally listed. No objections received. The application seeks to determine whether the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority is required for the siting and appearance of the proposed installation of  5G telecoms installation: H3G 15m street pole and additional equipment cabinets.The application has been assessed against the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 16 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended. The application has also been assessed against the policies of the National Planning Policy Framework and the current Development Plan policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy.The National Planning Policy Framework 2021 is clear at paragraph 118 in as much as the Local Planning Authority should not question need. Local planning authorities must determine applications on planning grounds only. They should not seek to prevent competition between different operators, question the need for an electronic communications system, or set health safeguards different from the International Commission guidelines for public exposure.This application is for prior approval, not for planning permission. Prior approval is a light-touch process which applies where the principle of the development has already been established (National Planning Practice Guidance) (Paragraph: 028 Reference ID: 13-028-20140306).Prior approval means that a developer has to seek approval from the local planning authority that specified elements of the development are acceptable before work can proceed. The matters for prior approval vary depending on the type of development and these are set out in full in the relevant parts in Schedule 2 to the General Permitted Development Order. A local planning authority cannot consider any other matters when determining a prior approval application (National Planning Practice Guidance) (Paragraph: 026 Reference ID: 13-026-20140306).The main considerations of the case are: - Siting and; - AppearanceThe proposed telecom apparatus would be sited in a highly visible location on the pavement on Kingston Road immediately west of the Fountain Roundabout and adjacent the bus shelter. The site is in close proximity to a number of residential properties.The height of the mast would be 15 m which would be in excess of 5 to 7m higher than a standard street lamp column (10m) and  telegraph pole (8m) which are typical other such perpendicular pieces of street furniture found in the locality. In addition the proposed equipments cabinets would create a proliferation of street furniture in this location which already has the presence of street lamps, bus stop, litter bins and other equipment cabinets present.It is considered that the proposal would not relate well to its surrounding and would result in an incongruous addition to the streetscene that would be visually intrusive and create visual clutter and detract from the character and appearance of the surrounding area. It is considered that the siting and appearance would be inappropriate in this case and it is recommended that prior approval be refused. Whilst not necessary we used the following policies to assit with the assessment CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.The need for an upgraded, modern telecommunications network is both acknowledged and appreciated, and indeed is given great weight in the decision making process; however, for the reasons cited above it is considered that the harm caused by the proposed installation would outweigh the benefits. In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. Amendments required to make the application acceptable are substantial and would materially change the development proposal.  They would require further consultation to be undertaken prior to determination which could not take place within the statutory determination period specified by the Department of Communities and Local Government.

On the 1st May 2024 the Council adopted a new Householder Local List. As per the new validation requirements, please complete and submit a Householder Checklist - Section 3. The new Householder Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applicationsThe LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct Checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed Checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review. Please do not simply state N/A in the checklist without a written justification.If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
